data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Rotary Knob Dimmer Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Rotary Knob Dimmer Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Rotary Knob Dimmer Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Rotary Knob Dimmer Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Keep on hand. Is work great for our electrician
1#Fixes the led flicker. Fixes led flicker 100%
2#Unexpected delayed action. Has a noticeable delay in turning on lights. When the switch is pressed to turn on the lights, there is a noticeable, a second or two, delay before the lights actually come on. The previous switch , which this one replaced, turned the lights on immediately, with no pause or delay. Not a real problem, just different and slightly annoying.
3#Flicker. Bad flicker with two different brands of LED bulbs.
4#Good dimmer switch. Reasonable price, decent value.works fine.
5#Flickers. Although stated it’s LED compatible but it flickers. Very annoying
6#Dims the fan and lights too. This switch does a really good job of dimming the old time hunter fans and lights. And, once you get them to that perfect brightness, just push it to turn things off or back on again. It remembers where the lights were dimmed, so they come back on at that same brightness.
7#Easy to install. Works as described and easy to install
8#GE light dimmer switch. Exactly what I needed to replace an old one that went out. Easy to install!!!
9#Still flickering. After installing this product according to the instructions, we still have LED flickering. Very disappointed
10#Doesn’t fit well. The screw holes do not lineup well with other plates, especially if there are multiple light switches in one faceplate. It took me a really long time and I had to stretch it to make it work. The dimmer works all right for vintage LED with filament… flickers a little no matter how much you adjust.
11#Works differently from the older models. I tested the switch with an ohm meter and at first I thought it was broken. No continuity between any of the poles. Hooked it up and switched it quickly on and off. didn't seem to work. Then I realized there must be some built-in electronics because there is a one second delay between switching it on and the lights turning on. Used incandescent lights. Once one gets used to that it works fine otherwise. Maybe electronics is the way they all are nowadays. That's probably why they are all more pricy that 2-way switches. My old switch has stranded pigtails that made it easy to hook up with wire nuts, This one has holes to insert the wires and screws to tighten them down. The wires come loose very easily so you really need to tighten those screws EXTREMELY tight.
12#It just works. I used this to replace a 3 way light dimmer switch that I blew up when reinstalling a ceiling fan that was not installed properly. I had the Ends of the wires capped off but the wire had some insulation missing that I also had to repair. SWITCH was simple. But the Ceiling fan had to have the mounting box installed from the attic. We all know how much fun that was ! But in the end the fan is sturdy and the light has a 3 way with dimmer.
13#NEVER, EVER AGAIN! I BOUGHT BOTH THESE RHEOSTATS TO REPLACE TWO IN MY HOME. FOOLISH ME I THOUGHT THEY WOULD HAVE CONNECTING WIRES BUT THEY DID NOT! THE SCREWS IN THE RHEAOSTATS WON'T SCREW IN OUT IN ORDER TO CONNECT TO THE WIRES IN THE BOX SO THEY ARE USELESS! I'M NOT IN THE POSITION TO RETURN THEM SO A WASTE OF MONEY AND A HUGE WASTE OF AN HOUR OF MY LIFE!
14#A Robust Dimmer. Handles 6, 15W LED bulbs with ease. Solidly built. Doesn’t dim as low as I would like. Admittedly this could be the bulbs. Also, the power on delay is uncomfortably long. Work around is to simply dim the lamps fully to off rather than turning off the switch. Not an option I like. I’m using this dimmer in single and three-way applications. Love the 3-way functionality - dimmer maintains setting even when I turn my room light off or on by a different switch.
15#Okay with delay in lighting. The item seems okay except there is a 1 to 2 second delay between tapping to turn on lights and the lights actually lighting up. Don’t know the cause, seems safe enough have been using for a couple of months now.
16#As advertised. Works as it should
17#Easy. Liked it. Easy to install.
18#Does exactly what it's supposed to do. My living room lights were AGGRESSIVE at night so a dimmer switch was essential. I like this one because it can dial down or push off. I will say there is a very slight delay when you click it on or off, but you get used to it. Seems sturdy and fit nicely into my existing outlet.
19#Dimmer switch for incandescent lights. Works. Mounted right up. Has a slow fade in when first switched on rather than the instant on switch I used to have prior. Works fine, just different.
20#Smooth working switch. This was a good replacement for my 50 year old dimmer that was getting worn out. It clicks very smoothly when you turn it on or off. It works with the three way wiring that the lights were wired for and fit my conduit box as well. I am very happy with this switch.
21#Perfect. Had to buy a new dimmer because the old one's spring got stuck. I like this one better because it feels better when you turn the knob and click it on and off.
22#Has a 1 to 2 second delay when turning on. I bought this to replace a worn-out dimmer switch of the same type. But this one has a 1 to 2 second delay when turning on the light. Long enough to question if it actually clicked on or not. For the first couple days after installing it, I would click it on, pause, then click it again, thinking maybe it didn't work the first time (which would switch it off again). Now I just click it and stand by it shaking my head in anger in the poor craftsmanship of the switch until it finally comes on. It's very aggravating. But it turns off instantly. It's only an issue when turning it on. The old switch didn't do that. The old switch also had a lot more dimming range too. I already knew to never buy a GE appliance, because they only last 4 years tops, but I figured General ELECTRIC would be an ok brand for electric components. It is substantially an all around lesser quality craftsmanship than Leviton dimmer switches. I don't expect it to last even a year (the Leviton switch that it replaced was 12 years old). Plus the knobs that were included were totally different than the ones in the picture, which isn't a big deal, but worth mentioning. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because it is a semi-functional device, but it is a very cheaply made switch that I would not recommend wasting your money on. Spend the extra few dollars and get the far superior Leviton switch instead.
23#Good product, seems to work, definitely not as shown as others have said. You don't get the same product as you see in the photo with the wires. You get a different version with screws. I take off 2 stars as the info and photo are not what you get... different product. It seems to work fine, but you don't get what you pay for. I didn't take a photo, it's already in the wall.
24#Doesn't light up bright. I got three of these. None of them go to full brightness plus each one has a 1 or 2 second delay. I removed and put others back in.
25#They Just Don't Make 'Em The Way They Used To! In the late 60s and early 70s, dimmer switches were new technology. I had one that lasted wellinto the 2000s. This is to replace one that went bad. There are screws on either side that can be used to loop the wires around. Neither could be loosened OR tightened. There are slots in the back that also can be used to fasten the wires, but there is no way to lock the wires into the slots. The face is also not recessed, so the cover plate sits proud of the wall. I was disappointed in the design and engineering of this switch. When I turned it on, the bulbs began blinking. I don't know if I got a defect or if this is the way they all are. Either way, It isn't working correctly.
26#Slow to turn on. Seconds delay going from off to on. Irritating. Makes no sense! Who wants that?
27#Did not work. Installed and would not work , removed and ordered different one
28#Long Delay turning on lights. Do not buy! We absolutely HATE this switch. There is a noticeable delay when you push it on, long enough to make someone think the light is not working at all. Horribly designed circuitry. Will never buy this again. UPDATE: Purchased a LEVITON Trimatron rotary dimmer switch (https://a.co/d/7j02cDp) and it has NO DELAY! Returning the GE switch tomorrow.
29#Not the same as advertised. Not the same switch that is advertised. did not have wire leads on it. Comes on slow like. Car interior light.
30#Works very well with my LED bulbs. Works great with my LED bulbs, easy install. Came with white and ivory knobs.
31#Used. Item cam in opened box and idk if it had been used or pieces missing. I returned them
32#Just what I needed. Worked great to replace my old dimmer for one that works with LED bulbs
33#A Bit Challenging. What I received was different than the pictures on the posting. At first I thought I received the wrong product. When I compared the UPC it was same number. Apparently, this was a cost reduction design. First this was advertised as a 3-way, multiple switch design. It turned out you can use it also for single-switch application. Just have one wire less. It does not come with the wires shown in photo's nor wire nuts. This is where it gets complicated. You have to use the wires you have in the wall and directly connect them to the new dimmer. They actually are pushed into holes and clamped in by tightening the screw terminals. In my case I only have 3 wires and different colors than shown on the dimmer switch. Didn't have a ground wire. I was able to figure out which wires go where, by looking how they were connected to old dimmer switch that had wire nuts. My house is 50 y/o so you might have a different setup. Somone has to change the pictures on posting as they will be different than the old design. Good Luck.
34#Excellent product. Product description is clear and instructions easy to follow.
35#Not the same devices sold 2 years ago... The new devices do NOT have wires attached for use with screw nuts, etc. like they did a year or so ago. They have bolts on the side and bottom to attach the wires from your house to the device. If your house is like mine, those wires are extremely difficult to pull/bend (and sometimes too short) which makes installing these quite an undertaking - very tedious, time-consuming.
36#Excellent Product. Exactly what I ordered. Works fine!
37#Awesome dimmer. Awesome dimmer works perfect!
38#Switch is fine. No plate? It works. Nice that they included an extra dial, so you have 1 white and 1 ivory, but they do not include any plate?
39#Easy to install. It has great instructions packed with the dimmer. The wires attached to it are plenty long enough for easy wiring.
40#GE 3 way dimmer. Easy install, good quality
41#Junk. Got a pair of these for my new basement remodel. I also got 3 regular (non 3 way ones). All 5 switches make a humming/ buzzing sound when the lights are dimmed. The lights are dimmable led and the sounds comes from the switch, not the lights. The 3 way switches cannot dim less than 50% or else the lights start to strobe. Also, if you dim the one switch and go to the second switch you cannot increase the light past where the first switch is set to. Basically making the concept of a 3 way dimmer unless. I guess it's a classic case of you get what you pay for. BTW, I'm a professional maintenance worker who's train in the electrical trade. In my professional opinion these switches are junk.
42#Failed after 18 months. Good while it lasted. Unfortunately, it only lasted 18 months.
43#Not really for LEDs. It’s analog and LEDs dont like it. Flickering all the time. No modes like a real digital rotary dimmer.
44#Great dimmer. Replaced broken switch.
45#Great p! Easy to install
46#Doesn't work well with dimmable LEDs. I tried with two different model dimmable LEDs. Model 1: Very narrow brightness range, and buzzing sound Model 2: Very narrow brigtness range, and flashing at the highest setting (i.e. it's getting overloaded). I think this is a conevntial dimmer designed before LED bulbs, with 'LED compatible' just slapped on. One thing I realize in retrospect - it should have a little wheel inside to adjust the output range, but does not.
47#Works well, looks sharp. Does what it needs to do, and looks sharp doing it.
48#Practical and useful device. Good product, good $, and fast delivery. Practical and useful device.
